answerText: aa [pronounced "ah-ah," but be lenient]	[10] Both pahoehoe and aa form this type of extrusive igneous rock upon hardening. This dark, mafic silicate rock composes most of the ocean floor, and gabbro is an intrusive form of this rock.
heading: MUT |2012 | 1 | 16 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An increase in flow can cause pahoehoe [pah-ho-ay-ho-ay] lava to change to to this other form of lava that is more viscous and flows faster.  [10] Name this type of lava which, unlike the puffy looking pillow lava, is really jagged and sharp.
